meanings.definition: The amount of electrical power expressed in watts.
meanings.sent1: The wattage of the light bulb determines how bright it shines.
meanings.sent2: The wattage of the microwave oven is 1200 watts.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally turned up the wattage on the blender, and now it's blending at turbo speed!
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a wattage that lit up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The wattage of the amplifier made the music sound incredibly powerful.

meanings.definition: The rate at which energy is used or produced in the form of watts.
meanings.sent1: The wattage of the heater determines how quickly it warms up the room.
meanings.sent2: The wattage of the solar panels affects how much electricity they generate.
meanings.sent3: The sudden increase in wattage from the power surge caused the lights to flicker.
meanings.sent4: His voice had a wattage that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The wattage of the engine determined how fast the car could go.
